item.description:

item.title: Outside 59 Hartland Road NW6 (again), 14th July
item.description:
PLEASE tell the residents of 59 Hartland road to STOP dumping their unwanted and broken furniture on the pavement. They are throwing various items out on a regular basis. Today’s offering is a dismantled children’s bed, blocking the way and imposing a pile of rubbish on the whole street. Action needs to be taken as this is becoming a real issue.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hartland Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Bus stop at Foresters Arms bus stop, 14th July
item.description:
The bin is full and needs emptying please. Can it be checked more regularly as households and cars are putting lots of rubbish in it every day. Many thanks and have a great week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Wickham Lane, Plumstead, London

item.title: Lumps of plaster in Hayles Street outside the allotments opposite Hedger Street., 14th July
item.description:

item.title: Self seeded tree outside 191/193 Brook Drive from large tree opposite., 14th July
item.description:
This issue is never dealt with properly so council have to return. They cut down a tree that had self seeded and put plugs in the remaining trunk. But the self seeding continues.The property owner also needs to help with the problem. It’s always an absolute eyesore with overflowing wheelie bins!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 189, Brook Drive, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian island broken, 14th July
item.description:
There have been issues with this pedestrian island for a while - it was broken quite a few months ago, but I'm unclear if it was previously fixed. In any case, it currently doesn't function as a way for pedestrians to safety cross the road.
